=
> DELETE deletes a URL. PUT creates a URL. Given that, I would prefer:
    =
>> 
    >> POST /cache/flusher

    Ant=C3=B3nio> Not exactly like that. PU=
T identifies the enclosed entity
    Ant=C3=B3nio> with the URI invoked. In=
 terms of CRUD, that means it can
    Ant=C3=B3nio> Create a URI identifyin=
g the enclosed entity if that URI
    Ant=C3=B3nio> doesen't exist, or Upda=
te it if it already exists. And
    Ant=C3=B3nio> can have othe rmeanings i=
n non-CRUD environments, as long
    Ant=C3=B3nio> as the identification UR=
I/entity is maintained

Yeah yeah yeah, know all that.


    Ant=C3=B3nio> =
So, PUT /cache/flusher is a viable option, in my opinion.

Don't think so. =
You're not creating the flusher url nor specifying new
contents.
